meanings.sent1: She decided to retwist her hair for a new look.
meanings.sent2: I need to retwist the lid on this jar to make sure it's closed tightly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to retwist the rope into a different shape.
meanings.sent4: He had to retwist his ankle to avoid stepping on the slippery floor.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's performance was mesmerizing as she retwist her body in graceful movements.

meanings.sent1: After baking, you can retwist the bread to create a unique shape.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor had to retwist the clay to fix the sculpture's proportions.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to retwist its body to reach the toy under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The wind started to retwist the branches of the tree in a strange pattern.
meanings.sent5: She had to retwist the wire to secure the loose connection.

meanings.definition: The act of twisting again or differently.
meanings.sent1: The retwist of the rope made it stronger for climbing.
meanings.sent2: His retwist of the plot in the story added an unexpected twist.
meanings.sent3: The retwist of the ribbon made the gift look more festive.
meanings.sent4: The retwist of the screw fixed the wobbly chair.
meanings.sent5: Her retwist of the dance routine impressed the audience with its creativity.
